item.name: 1-Glory (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Has Terminator expressed a desire to leave a personal legacy for history?
Has Terminator already outlined plans for increasing his legacy?

item.name: 2-Glory
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator seek rewards in another life (based on ideology, religion, cult, or sense of historical destiny)?

item.name: 3-Glory
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator relate to the world in terms of defeating or prevailing over neighbors, competitors, and adversaries?

item.name: 4-Glory (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator feel victimized and seek retribution?
Does Terminator blame others for his/own failings?
Is there evidence of social climbing, or status-seeking behavior, in Terminator that manifests itself in a quest for power and influence domestically?

item.name: 5-Glory
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator seek a "greater glory" in empire, hegemony, resurrection of past civilizations, or dominance?

item.name: 6-Glory (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator have a perceived genuine interest in improving his country and society?
Is Terminator asserting rights of his constituency or people, as part of the liberation, self-determination, or autonomy of a persecuted group?
Does Terminator envision a better future (peace, prosperity, freedom) as the motivating force for political action?

item.name: 7-Glory (1)
item.data: Does Terminator see his/her country's natural resources (e.g., gas, oil, minerals, water,) as instruments of national domination?
Does Terminator seek to use these resources to threaten or dominate other states?

item.name: 8-Glory (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Has Terminator grown up, or been historically socialized, in an anti-western culture?
Is Terminator duty-bound (i.e., because of professional obligations) or honor-bound (i.e., because of cultural background) to oppose the US?
Are there splits in Terminator's constituency with factions that tend to favor cooperation with the US with others opposed?

item.name: 9-Glory
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator see technology advantages to achieving national or personal glory (e.g., nuclear power or weaponry, missile technology, space exploration, telecommunications, etc.)?

item.name: 10-Greed (1)
item.data: Does the control of natural resources directly impact the power of Terminator?
Have there been credible allegations of corruption in relation to personal accumulation of wealth from natural resources?

item.name: 11-Greed (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have personal control, or aspirations to gain personal control, over property or territory?
If not, does that lack of control negatively impact Terminator?
Are Terminator's personal financial records subject to financial disclosure?

item.name: 12-Greed (2)
item.data: Are there credible allegations of financial corruption within leadership?
If yes, do the allegations include specific individuals within Terminator's group?

Are specific individuals within Terminator's group seen in one of the following ways: as beneficiaries personally, operating as middle men for others, or as part of a wider clique of corrupt officials?

item.name: 13-Greed
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator engage personally in illegal exploitation or trafficking of goods?

item.name: 14-Greed
item.data: Does Terminator have personal control over exploitation of natural resources, e.g., granting contracts, passing legislation, regulatory control, licensing, and other "musts" for industrial transactions?

item.name: 15-Greed
item.data: Does Terminator have personal control, or aspirations to gain personal control, over property or territory?

item.name: 16-Greed (1)
item.data: Does Terminator have a constituency dependent upon his/her personal largesse?
Does Terminator solicit/accept bribes?

item.name: 17-Greed (2)
item.data: Is Terminator using public office to provide extraordinary benefits or favors to a particular constituency, elite group, clan or family?
Is the public aware of this through press reports or official investigations?
Has official corruption negatively affected the country (through, for example, decreased legitimacy of the gov't, lost foreign investment, reduction in foreign aid or credit ratings, or sanctions)?

item.name: 18-Greed (2)
item.data: Is there a belief, or evidence, that Terminator is accumulating excessive wealth from his/her office?
Is Terminator associated with corruption allegations related to personal wealth?
Have there been corruption charges against Terminator filed in court, external indictments, or investigations?

item.name: 19-Glory (1)
item.data: Does Terminator seek power for his/her own sake, with no limits, to achieve glory as a great leader?
Is Terminator willing to bear heavy costs in terms of his/her own country's lives and treasure to pursue and maintain power?

item.name: 20-Governance (2)
item.data: Is Terminator seen by his constituency as contributing to good governance (e.g., representing their interests, honest, dedicated, and providing public goods, such as education, housing, health, transportation, sanitation)?
Has Terminator's constituency benefited in public services, redress of grievances, quality of life and opportunity?
Do the people feel that they have suffered under Terminator's leadership ?

item.name: 21-Governance (1)
item.data: Is Terminator considered to be governing in the public's interest?
Does Terminator have a record of success in his/her leadership skills?

item.name: 22-Governance
item.data: Does the military have major influence on Terminator?

item.name: 23-Governance (1)
item.data: Are there constitutional or legal limits to Terminator holding office (term limits)?
Has Terminator stayed in office for more than 10 years?

item.name: 24-Governance (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator in a position to attain political power through constitutional means?
Is Terminator willing and able to form alliances, compromise, and be accountable for his actions?

item.name: 25-Grievance
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social

item.name: 26-Governance (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator have a negative attitude toward the issue being considered in this case?
Does Terminator have a positive attitude toward the issue being considered in this case?

item.name: 27-Grievance
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator's political rhetoric full of "hate speech" or nationalistic slogans that single out particular groups to blame for the nation's or constituency's misfortunes?

item.name: 28-Governance (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator likely to be positively influenced on the issue based on the method under consideration in this case?
Is Terminator likely to be negatively influenced on the issue based on the method under consideration in this case?

item.name: 29-Grievance (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator's group locked in a cycle of revenge and looking for retribution?
Does Terminator have the backing of his constituency in seeking revenge?
Does Terminator have access to the resources needed to stage a coup d'etat, mass protest, or insurgency?

item.name: 30-Governance
item.data: Has Terminator been responsible for major decisions/policies that have hurt the country politically, economically or socially?

item.name: 31-Grievance (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Has Terminator made provocative decisions that tap into group grievance (e.g., revoke the autonomy of a province; deny linguistic/religious/ or cultural rights; persecute leaders who are spokespersons for the group; refuse equal rights for the group members)?
Are external parties negatively influencing the decisions of Terminator that destabilize the situation?

item.name: 32-Governance (1)
item.data: Does Terminator have a conflict of interest between what is good for his/her private interests and those of the country as a whole?
Have those conflicts of interest been made public?

item.name: 33-Grievance (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator mobilize support by appealing to group identities?
Does Terminator have the ability to create popular support for armed resistance to redress group grievance?
Has Terminator advocated armed resistance, launched attacks, and/or organized violent protests in defense of group grievance?

item.name: 34-Grievance (2)
item.data: Has Terminator tried to retake territory that he believes belongs to him, his country or his constituency?
Has Terminator tried to create facts on the ground, by settlements, economic influence, payments to other groups, etc.?
Has the action taken created conflict?

item.name: 35-Grievance (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator's group feel marginalized and powerless in the social and political structure of society?
Is Terminator's group looking for acquisition of territory, economic benefits, political representation political autonomy?
Does Terminator's group have access to arms and recruits and/or to economic resources?

item.name: 36-Grievance (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Has Terminator's group been the victim of persecution, prejudice or atrocities?
Has Terminator's group, in its own view, been unable to get justice through legal, constitutional or economic means?
Does Terminator's group feel a sense of grievance for past injustices that have not been redressed?

item.name: 37-Greed
item.data: Does holding office open up hidden sources of the wealth for Terminator that are not controlled by the legislature, the courts, or seen by the media?

item.name: 38-Greed (1)
item.data: Is Terminator making decisions that consistently favor one group of people over the other?
Do the decisions threaten the ability of Terminator to provide for the general good of the people?

item.name: 39-Greed (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have aspirations to acquire personal control over property or territory belonging to other individuals, corporations or states?
Does Terminator defend these aspirations politically, as in populist or nationalist terms?
Does Terminator have the legal, military or political power to fulfill his ambitions?

item.name: 40-Greed
item.data: Is Terminator calling for the state's seizure, occupation, or takeover of property or territory by existing authorities or newly formed vigilante groups?

item.name: 41-Greed (2)
item.data: Is Terminator's influence dependent upon his/her personal wealth?
Does Terminator have access to non-governmental sources of wealth?
Does Terminator have the power to make decisions and/or appointments that will permit him/her to acquire wealth without proper oversight or transparency?

item.name: 42-Greed (1)
item.data: Is Terminator viewed by the public as a corrupt and wealthy official?
Does Terminator represent the business elites and not the ordinary constituents?

item.name: 1-Political (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have a military background or close ties to the military?
Does Terminator have an underlying military constituency?
Is this military constituency reliable? How strong is this military?

item.name: 2-Political (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have formal political authority?
Does Terminator wield this power absolutely?
Are there institutional checks and balances on Terminator's political authority?

item.name: 3-Social (2)
item.data: Is Terminator leader of a particular class of people?
Is this a positive or negative identification?
If negative, is it because that higher class group is considered a dominant and repressive ruling group?

item.name: 4-Political (1)
item.data: Does Terminator have good relations with influential elites in other branches of government?
Is there an organized opposition?

item.name: 5-Political (1)
item.data: Is Terminator involved in illicit economic activities that are not controlled by the central government?
Has such corruption undermined the political legitimacy of Terminator?

item.name: 6-Social
item.data: Is Terminator a "natural" inheritor of influence and power?

item.name: 7-Political
item.data: Is Terminator able to exceed his/her authority and influence constitutionally?

item.name: 8-Political
item.data: Does Terminator exercise control and influence in local enclaves?

item.name: 9-Social (1)
item.data: Is Terminator identified with a political dynasty, privileged class, dominant clan or tribe, or aristocracy?
Is Terminator linked to a social group (ethnic, racial, religious, language) that obliges him/her to take certain positions on issues to advance the group interests?

item.name: 10-Political
item.data: Does Terminator have the power to block laws passed by the legislature?

item.name: 11-Political (1)
item.data: Does Terminator exercise control and influence throughout the country?
If not, does this have the potential to threaten central control?

item.name: 12-Social
item.data: Is Terminator's influence been enhanced by his reputation (e.g., as an elder statesman) despite not holding office or leading a party or constituency?

item.name: 13-Physical (2)
item.data: Does Terminator control the police?
Do the police support Terminator?
Are the police repressive?

item.name: 14-Political
item.data: Does Terminator have the power to block decisions by the executive?

item.name: 15-Political
item.data: Are there term limits on the office of Terminator?

item.name: 16-Social
item.data: Does Terminator use his/her powers of persuasion to advance national goals?

item.name: 17-Physical (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have the means to physically enforce his power through the use of force?
Is this physical control recognized as legitimate?
Is this physical control constitutional or within the bounds of the rule of law?

item.name: 18-Political
item.data: Does Terminator have the power to appoint the members of the judiciary?

item.name: 19-Political
item.data: Is the system through which Terminator was elected regarded by the majority as free and fair?

item.name: 20-Social (1)
item.data: Is Terminator likely to exercise influence and exert power based on persuasion and incentives?
Has Terminator been successful in achieving his/her goals based on this style of governance?

item.name: 21-Political
item.data: Does Terminator have the power to delegate influence to others, such as the security apparatus?

item.name: 22-Political (1)
item.data: Is Terminator democratically elected?
Is Terminator's influence wielded through official office?

item.name: 23-Physical (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have his/her own militia?
Are the militias loyal and support Terminator's agenda?
Are the militias capable of being lured into the orbit of other influencials?

item.name: 24-Social
item.data: Does Terminator have a reputation for brutality?

item.name: 25-Physical (2)
item.data: Does Terminator control the military?
Does the military support Terminator?
Is the military repressive?

item.name: 26-Political (1)
item.data: Is Terminator viewed by the majority of the people as acting in the country's best interest?
Are there substantial or powerful minorities who feel marginalized by Terminator?

item.name: 27-Political (1)
item.data: Has Terminator been prosecuted for a crime?
Has Terminator been convicted of a crime?

item.name: 28-Social (2)
item.data: Is Terminator's reputation based on fear?
Is Terminator likely exercise influence and exert power based on threats or intimidation?
Has Terminator inflicted physical, financial or personal harm on his opponents to advance his/her own ends?

item.name: 29-Resources
item.data: Does Terminator have financial control of the media?

item.name: 30-Political
item.data: Is Terminator corrupt or widely perceived to be corrupt?

item.name: 31-Social (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator have a favorable or unfavorable personal reputation?
Is that reputation of the kind that can influence large numbers of people on political or economic issues?

item.name: 32-Resources (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have the ability to mobilize large numbers of people in support of particular policies or issues?
Would the constituency follow Terminator's call for social or political action?
Would the constituency follow Terminator's call for use of violence to advance a cause?

item.name: 33-Resources (2)
item.data: Does Terminator exert undue influence over the media?
Does Terminator exert control over the media in other ways that may compromise its independence?
Is the media free to criticize Terminator without retribution or harassment?

item.name: 34-Resources (2)
item.data: Does Terminator own any media?
Is the media ownership transparent?
Does an opposition media exist?

item.name: 35-Political (1)
item.data: Does Terminator, in his/her official capacity, exercise a monopoly on the use of force throughout the country?
Does Terminator exercise control of the use of force within his/her own area, such as a "no-go zone," an autonomous province, or a rebel enclave?

item.name: 36-Political
item.data: Does Terminator have military command of active armed forces?

item.name: 37-Affinity (2)
item.data: Is Terminator's lifestyle a matter of controversy (e.g., is Terminator accused of being too lavish, too western in dress or food preferences, not traditional in marriage choices, womanizer, too imperial, etc)?
Does Terminator's lifestyle facilitate positive regard? (includes class, religion, family, etc.)
Does Terminator's lifestyle generate respect and admiration among his constituency?

item.name: 38-Affinity (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have a strong professional affiliation (lawyer, cleric, businessman, celebrity, economist)?
Is Terminator's professional standing respected?
Does that profession allow Terminator to exercise political influence?

item.name: 39-Physical (2)
item.data: Does Terminator control intelligence organizations?
Do intelligence organizations implement population control measures?
Are intelligence organizations repressive?

item.name: 40-Physical (2)
item.data: Does Terminator control illicit activities, such as gangs?
Is Terminator personally involved in illicit activities?
Is Terminator likely to be indicted for his illicit activities?

item.name: 41-Physical (1)
item.data: Does Terminator dominate by means of physical intimidation, such as arrest?
Does Terminator utilize demagoguery to generate populist support?

item.name: 42-Physical (1)
item.data: Does Terminator exercise dominance by popular support of the majority ?
Does the population support Terminator because of the service and protection he provides to his people?

item.name: 43-Affinity (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator a member of a dominant ethnic group?
Does Terminator use ethnicity as a political device to exercise influence and mobilize support?
Does Terminator use ethnicity to promote hatred and retribution of other groups?

item.name: 44-Political
item.data: Does Terminator control "no-go zones" or autonomous pockets of influence in selected areas of the country?

item.name: 45-Affinity (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does the ethnicity of Terminator foster distrust of other ethnic groups?
Does Terminator marginalize other ethnic groups ?

item.name: 46-Political (1)
item.data: Does Terminator have a role in protecting the territorial integrity of the country against outsiders?
Does he exercise that influence well?

item.name: 47-Affinity
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator believe violence must be used to get equal representation?

item.name: 48-Political
item.data: Does Terminator support the ideology or religious affiliation of non-state constituencies or groups?

item.name: 49-Affinity
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator exercise influence across borders?

item.name: 50-Political (2)
item.data: Does Terminator support a state-sponsored national ideology or religion?
Is repression or force used to impose the ideology or religion on the people?
Is there an opposing ideology rooted in local constituencies that generates support among the people?

item.name: 51-Affinity (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator identified with a particular ethnic group?
Does this group have deep-seated grievances that it feels are not being addressed?
Does Terminator feel the need to mobilize for effective political action to redress those grievances?

item.name: 52-Moral (1)
item.data: Is Terminator highly regarded because of his/her status ideologically or religiously in society?
Does Terminator feel morally bound by this creed (e.g., destined to be a martyr, spearhead of the revolution, the supreme leaders, etc.)?

item.name: 53-Moral
item.data: Does Terminator carry a popular name acknowledging personal popularity or influence?

item.name: 54-Moral
item.data: Has Terminator sacrificed self for the good of the people or the nation?

item.name: 55-Moral
item.data: Is Terminator highly regarded because of his/her personal stature (as opposed to ideological appeal, ethnic or religious ties, etc.) ?

item.name: 56-Moral (1)
item.data: Is Terminator highly regarded in society?
Does Terminator conduct affairs with a internalized sense of personal integrity?

item.name: 57-Affinity (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator share a common language with his/her constituents?
Does Terminator communicate at home in more than one language?

Is Terminator regarded as too western due to his/her educational background and/or linguistic preferences (e.g., speaks English, cannot speak a native tongue, seems culturally aloof from his people, too intellectual)?

item.name: 58-Moral (1)
item.data: Has Terminator acted in a way that society regards as admirable?
In your opinion, is that behavior a veneer, just to earn constituency support, or a genuine reflection of extraordinary personal character?

item.name: 59-Affinity (2)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Does Terminator's religious affiliation provide a way of acquiring or expanding power?
Does Terminator's influence depend upon religion?
Does the religion give Terminator "license" to exert influence?

item.name: 60-Moral
item.data: Is Terminator highly regarded for vision and commitment?

item.name: 61-Affinity (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is there hostility between Terminator and the United States based on affinity?
Is Terminator dogmatic in that hostility and unwilling to seek engagement?

item.name: 62-Moral
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator highly regarded for intellect?

item.name: 63-Affinity
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is there a history of hostility between Terminator and other ethnic groups?

item.name: 64-Political (2)
item.data: Does Terminator, in his/her official capacity, exercise physical control of the state throughout the country?
Is Terminator's territorial authority challenged by other entities for territorial control?
Does Terminator exercise territorial influence well?

item.name: 65-Moral
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator regarded as a person of conviction who will stand up for principles, even it is unpopular?

item.name: 66-Resources (2)
item.data: Does Terminator exercise direct control over significant natural resources, such as diamonds, oil, gas, land and other minerals or natural resources?
Are they used for patronage and cooptation?
Are the resources channeled into illicit activities?

item.name: 67-Resources (1)
item.data: Does Terminator have control over government contracts?
Has Terminator been charged with taking kick-backs or bribes in granting contracts?

item.name: 68-Resources (1)
item.data: Is Terminator's control of government assets, legal and transparent?
Has Terminator been charged with criminal offences with regard to the management of natural resources or national assets?

item.name: 69-Resources (2)
item.data: Does Terminator control government economic assets, such as land, revenue, minerals, etc.?
Does Terminator have direct control over government assets? (e.g., can he/she order a land confiscation, oppressive taxation)?
Can Terminator withdraw revenue from the treasury at will?

item.name: 70-Resources (1)
item.data: Is Terminator's control of the private sector considered threatening by other stakeholders?
If so, are the rival economic forces likely to fight for control of these resources?

item.name: 71-Resources (1)
item.data: Does Terminator have the ability to exert extraordinary control of the private sector single-handedly?
Does the quest for control of the private sector drive Terminator's decisions and policies?

item.name: 72-Resources (1)
item.data: Is Terminator's influence over economic resources legal or illegal?
Does Terminator use his/her position (in government or an organization) to acquire financial resources personally?

item.name: 73-Resources (1)
item.data: Does Terminator control economic resources?
Is Terminator's influence over economic resources formal (i.e., through position in government or an organization)?

item.name: 74-Moral
item.data: Is Terminator seen as a political "spoiler," an outsider with influence?

item.name: 75-Moral (1)
item.data: Is Terminator seen as a political "insider"?
Does Terminator exert influence by virtue of the fact of being a leader of that group?

item.name: 76-Moral (1)
item.data: Does Terminator have a leadership vision that inspires his/her constituencies?
Is Terminator an inspirational leader?

item.name: 77-Moral (1)
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator considered to have natural leadership qualities?
Is Terminator seen as a leader because of having moral character?

item.name: 78-Moral (1)
item.data: Is Terminator's influence based upon his/her religious stature?
Does Terminator have religious opponents who challenge his leadership credentials on religious grounds?

item.name: 79-Moral (1)
item.data: Does Terminator exercise influence by advocating a radical interpretation of the religion?
Does Terminator personify his/her people's story?

item.name: 80-Moral (2)
item.data: Does Terminator have charisma?
Is Terminator eloquent and have good communication skills?
Does Terminator "connect" with the people?

item.name: 81-Resources (1)
item.data: Are there other economically valuable resources at Terminator's disposal, such as jobs or prestigious appointments?
Has Terminator demonstrated a willingness to tap these resources for personal advantage?

item.name: 82-Social (1)
item.data: Is Terminator a leader of a local community?

Is he/she the leader of a virtual community (e.g., Muslims, diasporas; refugees; and identity-based groups whose members do not meet face to face but share a common cause, such as the anti-globalization movement)?

item.name: 83-Social
item.data: Is Terminator a leader of a new generation of group activists?

item.name: 84-Social (2)
item.data: Does Terminator assume a historical destiny to achieve something great for their people?
Does that sense of historical destiny involve the use of violence?
Does that sense of destiny involve peaceful political mobilization to fulfill Terminator's mission?

item.name: 85-Social
item.data: Is Terminator a leader of a historical movement?

item.name: 86-Social
item.data: Is Terminator considered a leader of a generation?

item.name: 87-Social
item.keyword: Political, Religious, Security, Intelligence, Economic, Social
item.data: Is Terminator more highly educated than the majority of the population?
